pull.title: [Qt] add shortcurts for debug-/console-window
pull.body: Opening the console- or the debug-window (info tab) seems to be a action that many users do often. This  PR adds a shortcut for opening the debug window (`shift-ctrl-D`) and one for showing directly the console (`shift-ctrl-C`). Considered to be a undocumented expert feature.

events.body: BTW - will test on OS X later today - Ctrl key...

@paveljanik the problem with a parameter for `showDebugWindow()` is, that binding a parameter to a signal is non-trivial (requires a `QSignalMapper`) and result in a uncommon code. I have considered that but was going for the more clear way which not really involves more code line (maybe +2).

I have testes it on OSX. QT automaps the `OSX-cmd` key to `ctrl`. Needs testing on Linux/Windows.

events.body: Binaries if someone likes to test this on Windows or Linux: https://bitcoin.jonasschnelli.ch/pulls/7000/
Just tested this also on Windows and Linux/Ubuntu. Works.
Hah, would be awesome if someone wrote a manual/help function for the GUI in the first place...

comments.body: This looks weird, allocating a freely-floating object, but I do think it is correct. The object will become a child of `*this`, and automatically freed with it.
Right. It looks a bit strange. But i think it should compile fine and leaves no men-leak (and requires less code).
